description: In the last example, the final JSON is invalid, because it has a comma in the last element of the array. To solve it, we can use the if else conditions. There are multiple options for evaluating an item. In this case, we will check that the element is the last one in the list with <#if fragment?is_last><#else>,</#if>. If the element is not the last one, a comma will be printed. In this exercise, fix the mapping provided.
user_template:
<#assign jpath=handlers("JsonHandler")>
<#assign locationsURL = "{\"url\" : \"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/helio-ecosystem/helio-ecosystem/main/resources/mappings-data/01%20_SIoTRx_basic_tutorial/locations.json\"}">
<#assign location=providers("URLProvider", locationsURL)>
[<#list jpath.filter("$.*",location) as fragment>
{"name" : "[=jpath.filter("$.",fragment)]"}<#if fragment><#else>.</#if>
</#list>
]
solution_template:
<#assign jpath=handlers("JsonHandler")>
<#assign locationsURL = "{\"url\" : \"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/helio-ecosystem/helio-ecosystem/main/resources/mappings-data/01%20_SIoTRx_basic_tutorial/locations.json\"}">
<#assign location=providers("URLProvider", locationsURL)>
[<#list jpath.filter("$.*",location) as fragment>
{"name" : "[=jpath.filter("$.name",fragment)]"}<#if fragment?is_last><#else>,</#if>
</#list>
]
